CSSPositionTryRule.summary: The CSSPositionTryRule interface describes an object representing a @position-try at-rule.

remarks.para:
-
-@position-try
-position-try-fallbacks
-CSS anchor positioning module
-Using CSS anchor positioning
-Handling overflow: try options and conditional hiding

CSSPositionTryRuleName.summary: The name read-only property of the interface represents the name of the position try fallback option specified by the _position-try at-rule's dashed-ident.

remarks.para:
-
-@position-try
-position-try-fallbacks
-CSS anchor positioning module
-Using CSS anchor positioning
-Handling overflow: try options and conditional hiding

CSSPositionTryRuleStyle.summary: The read-only style property of the interface contains a object representing the descriptors available in the {{cssxref("@position-try")}} rule's body.

remarks.para:
-
-@position-try
-position-try-fallbacks
-CSS anchor positioning module
-Using CSS anchor positioning
-Handling overflow: try options and conditional hiding

CSSPositionTryRuleStyle.value: A object.Although the style property itself is read-only in the sense that you can't replace the CSSPositionTryDescriptors object, you can still assign to the style property directly, which is equivalent to assigning to its property. You can also modify the CSSPositionTryDescriptors object using the and methods.
